column1: The Goban was the master of sixteen trades. There was no beating him; he had got the gift. He went one time to Quin Abbey when it was building
column3: and the men were going to their dinner
column5: and they began to jibe at him
column6: and the foreman said 'Make now a cat-and-nine-tails while we are at our dinner
column7: if you are any good.' And he took the chisel and cut it in the rough in the stone
column8: a cat with nine tails coming from it
column9: and there it was complete when they came out from their dinner. There was no beating him. He learned no trade
column10: but he was master of sixteen. That is the way
column11: a man that has the gift will get more out of his own brain than another will get through learning. There is many a man without learning will get the better of a college-bred man
column12: and will have better words too. Those that make inventions in these days have the gift
column13: such a man now as Edison
column14: with all he has got out of electricity.
